meanings.definition: A device that impels or drives something forward.
meanings.sent1: The impellor of the boat helped it move through the water smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The impellor in the engine is responsible for propelling the vehicle forward.
meanings.sent3: The impellor in the fan was so powerful that it blew my hat off!
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as an impellor, pushing her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The impellor spun rapidly, creating a strong current in the water.

meanings.definition: One who impels or urges on.
meanings.sent1: As a coach, he was a great impellor for the team, always motivating them to do their best.
meanings.sent2: The impellor of change, she inspired others to take action and make a difference.
meanings.sent3: The impellor of the group, he was always the first to suggest new ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as an impellor, driving him to pursue his dreams relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: He was known as the impellor of innovation, constantly pushing boundaries and exploring new possibilities.
